intro: Herpestis rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed herb. It is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States, characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. Its botanical features make it identifiable by its unique leaf shape and flowering pattern.
